steps.title: Open Snapchat.
steps.content: Open Snapchat . It’s the yellow icon with a white ghost on your home screen.

steps.title: Tap the shutter icon to take your photo.
steps.content: Tap the shutter icon to take your photo. It’s the large circle at the bottom of the camera screen.

steps.title: Add effects, text, and doodles.
steps.content: Add effects, text, and doodles. You can skip this step if you don’t want to use Snapchat’s editing options.

steps.title: Tap the Save icon.
steps.content: Tap the Save icon. It’s the square with an upward-facing icon at the bottom of the screen. This will save your photo to Snapchat Memories. If it’s your first time saving to your Memories, you’ll be prompted to choose a location to which you’ll save your Memories. You can choose “Memories Only” (save to Snapchat’s server) or “Memories and Camera Roll” to also save a copy of the photo on your device.

steps.title: Tap X.
steps.content: Tap X . It’s at the top left corner of the screen.

steps.title: Swipe up on the camera screen.
steps.content: Swipe up on the camera screen. This opens your Memories.

steps.title: Tap Camera Roll to find your photo.
steps.content: Tap Camera Roll to find your photo. It’s just beneath the word “Memories” at the top of the screen. You should see your photo. [1] X Research source If you don’t see your photo in Camera Roll, you’ll have to save it there. To do this: Tap Snaps at the top of the screen. Tap and hold the photo until the menu appears. Tap Export Snap . Tap Save Image .

steps.title: Press the Home button.
steps.content: Press the Home button. It’s the round button at the bottom of the screen. This will bring you back to the home screen.

steps.title: Open Photos.
steps.content: Open Photos . It’s the white icon with a rainbow flower (iPhone/iPad) on your home screen.

steps.title: Tap All Photos.
steps.content: Tap All Photos .

steps.title: Tap the photo you want to rotate.
steps.content: Tap the photo you want to rotate.

steps.title: Tap the Edit icon.
steps.content: Tap the Edit icon. It’s at the bottom of the screen and looks like three horizontal lines with hollow circles.

steps.title: Tap the Crop and Rotate icon.
steps.content: Tap the Crop and Rotate icon. It’s the first icon at the bottom of the screen next to the word “Cancel.”

steps.title: Tap the Rotate icon.
steps.content: Tap the Rotate icon. It’s the icon with a square and an arrow at the image’s bottom left corner. This will turn your image counter-clockwise. When you’re satisfied, tap Done .

steps.title: Return to Snapchat.
steps.content: Return to Snapchat. You can get there quickly by double-clicking the Home button, then selecting the Snapchat window.

steps.title: Swipe up on the Camera screen.
steps.content: Swipe up on the Camera screen. This will open your Memories.

steps.title: Tap Camera Roll.
steps.content: Tap Camera Roll . Your rotated photo now appears at the top of the list.

steps.title: Tap and hold the photo.
steps.content: Tap and hold the photo. Lift your finger when the gray menu appears.

steps.title: Tap the Send icon.
steps.content: Tap the Send icon. It’s the blue paper airplane at the bottom of your photo. Now you can send the Snap to a friend or post it to your Story.

steps.title: Press the Home button.
steps.content: Press the Home button. It’s the circle icon at the bottom of the screen. This will bring you back to the home screen.

steps.title: Open Photos.
steps.content: Open Photos . It’s the rainbow pinwheel (Android) icon on your home screen. If you don’t see it on the home screen, tap the Apps icon (usually a circle with 6 dots inside) and open it from there. If you use another app to manage and edit your photos, you can use that app to rotate the image.

steps.title: Tap the photo to open it.
steps.content: Tap the photo to open it. It should be at the top of the photo list. If you don’t see the photo, tap the ☰ at the top left corner of the screen, then select Device Folders . You should see the photo in the Camera folder.

steps.title: Tap the Edit icon.
steps.content: Tap the Edit icon. It’s the icon of a pencil at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Tap the Crop and Rotate icon.
steps.content: Tap the Crop and Rotate icon. It’s the third icon at the bottom of the screen that has several arrows pointing in various directions.

steps.title: Rotate the photo.
steps.content: Rotate the photo. Tap the button at the bottom right side of the photo to turn it counter-clockwise. Keep tapping until it looks the way you want it, then tap Done .

steps.title: Return to Snapchat.
steps.content: Return to Snapchat. You can do this by viewing your open apps (Usually a square button at the bottom of the screen), then selecting Snapchat.
